subject: Re: [junit] Re: tests in separate directory, was: testing private methods
msgSnippet: ... It is a basic feature in Eclipse to specify several source folders. IDEA is great, and it was really cheap before Eclipse was available ;-) Regards, Markus
messageBody:
Craig Demyanovich wrote:
> IDEA (http://www.intellij.com) has a source tree view that is perfect
> for this situation. With tests in the same package but in different
> project subtrees, the view looks like this:
>
> - ... \src\main
> - com
> - <company>
> + <pkg1>
> + <pkg2>
>
> - ... \src\test
> - com
> - <company>
> + <pkg1>
> + <pkg2>
>
> With all that I've heard about Eclipse, I'm surprised this type of view
> is not present.

It is a basic feature in Eclipse to specify several source folders.

IDEA is great, and it was really cheap before Eclipse was available ;-)

Regards,
Markus
